channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Very poor road surface and worsening., 11th February
item.description:
Several potholes across Elmfield Road unavoidable, with the what3words ///jobs.target.kind area being the worst.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Elmfield Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Existing pothole increasing in size., 11th February
item.description:
Pothole almost unavoidable when turning left from Tewkesbury Rd onto Elm St. what 3 words: ///miles.total.exam
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elm Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.title: No street lights working, 11th February
item.description:
The lights haven’t been working for a while now and it’s dangerous!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Orchard Avenue, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: 4 or 5 large pot holes that have made driving on the lane very difficult, 11th February
item.description:
The badly damaged tarmac is between the house named 'Brookside' on the map and the junction with Pillcroft Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Walking this track from the Staverton direction, there is no sign or obvious physical feature to indicate that the footpath diverts off of the track, 11th February
item.description:
The footpath from Staverton follows a track and is apparently supposed to divert off of the track in the direction of the B4634, but because this is not obvious at all, it is very easy to continue on down the track (where it is no longer legally a right of way) and end up on private land. A signpost should really be installed to prevent accidental trespassing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Boddington Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent parking on the corner of Charlecote Corner presents a danger to residents when existing the street onto The Highgrove, 11th February
item.description:
Persistent parking at school drop off and pick up on the junction of Charlecote Corner and The Highgrove forces residents to aim right, on the wrong side of the road before being able to turn left towards Voxwell Lane and completely obstructs the view of oncoming traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, The Highgrove, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on the pavement south side of Hayden Road, 11th February
item.description:
Near the Village Road end of Hayden Road, there is an unmarked small but deep pothole that has caused my mother to fall over in the street. It has been there for at very least a few years. Fix it, immediately.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Hayden Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verge has been destroyed by repeated parking. It is now mud which is spilling on to the pavement which children are walking through to school. The mud is slippery presenting a danger. The grass does not recover and remains unsightly and not in keeping with the rest of the area., 11th February
item.description:
'Grass' verge on Voxwell Lane between Grangefield Approach and The Highgrove.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Voxwell Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep pothole full of water so can't be seen. Delivery drivers are also complaining about this one and all the others., 11th February
item.description:
By the field on left as you are going down the lane towards main road. This one is additional to all the others in the Lane that have already been reported.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury

item.title: Deformed road that now causes issues of wheels touching the ground but transmission sits/scrapes on the centre of the road. A structural survey needs to be reviewed as the drain into the hedge is now becoming higher than the sides of the road., 11th February
item.description:
Outside the houses before the bend at the top near the bridge
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury

item.title: Pavement is blocked with collapsed wall., 11th February
item.description:
This is unsafe because pedestrians are forced to walk on the road, and visibility of vehicles approaching from the Gloucester direction is obstructed. As a result, cars are pulling out into traffic dangerously.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Several items of furniture, 11th February
item.description:
Dumped near the Sycamore Court street sign off Springbank Road near the junction with Fiddler's Green Lane. Looks like a divan, chest of drawers and a tall fridge or freezer. Not sure how long it has been there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sycamore Court, Golden Valley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3rd time reporting this!!!!!, 11th February
item.description:
See ref 8113611 and 8375578. There has been no information sent to us with regards to this and it has not been resolved however it has been closed. In very heavy rainfall the driveway will flood and flood in to the house and the next door neighbours property unless the sandbags are out. This has happened a few times in the last few years but luckily we were able to stop it. Please can this be addressed asap. At least try to actually contact me rather than continuing to close the tickets without explaining what is happening.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnmeadow Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Road is in an appalling state and is now difficult to drive on. Has been repaired recently but to a very poor standard, you may as well not have bothered., 11th February
item.description:
There are numerous potholes and if walking up the road especially at night it is now dangerous. Driving is difficult and now damaging vehicles suspension. This road desperately needs properly resurfacing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This drain is completely blocked and a lot of water cascades down this road from the flooded field, 11th February
item.description:
The drain outside Beverston is completely blocked

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
